title: Why Not Luigi Garlaschelli?
post:
I admit that Colin Berry has done some work
(and with optical microscopy images), instead
we are often dealing only with long discussions…
But…
Where are advanced controls and comparisons
about thin layers on treated linens?
In any case : “…something which has the same
characteristics as the Shroud.”
is not the Shroud because (really)
it’s something which has NEAR “the same
characteristics as the Shroud”, but it IS NOT
the Shroud … and then this is a glaring truth.
See also another problem:
>Often I indicated the AFM three-point bending test
(a test useful in order to measure the Young’s modulus).
Link:
https://shroudstory.com/2015/06/29/ces-convention-in-crdoba-cabra-this-october/
Provisional conclusion.
Garlaschelli is very smart but we must be more serious
when dealing with a topic such as the Shroud
(= a great treasure of Faith)..
So…
Here we are very far from the previous
analytical problems/levels (= AFM three-point bending test,
AFM analyses, etc.)…
But one thing is now clear:
No one works for nothing …
Unless someone follows my “analytical sermons”
and then want to really works, with a set of new tests
on linen fibrils coming from the Shroud, etc.!
Perhaps this can be done by a team that works
“for the glory” and then not want money …
or a team that is really adept at finding funds
(but without stealing USB-keys of mine …).
